description: From fore- +‎ arm. Compare Dutch voorarm (“forearm”), Danish forarm (“forearm”), German Vorderarm (“forearm”).

entries.meaning: The part of the arm between the wrist and the elbow.
(firearms) A section of the weapon between the receiver and the muzzle, used to hold the firearm steady.

verbs.description: forearm (third-person singular simple present forearms, present participle forearming, simple past and past participle forearmed)

entries.meaning: (transitive, sometimes figurative) To arm in preparation.
